# sakura_iam_auth (Data Source)

Get information about the IAM Authentication settings.

## Example Usage

```terraform
data "sakura_iam_auth" "foobar" {}
```

<!-- schema generated by tfplugindocs -->
## Schema

### Read-Only

- `conditions` (Attributes) (see [below for nested schema](#nestedatt--conditions))
- `password_policy` (Attributes) (see [below for nested schema](#nestedatt--password_policy))

<a id="nestedatt--conditions"></a>
### Nested Schema for `conditions`

Read-Only:

- `datetime_restriction` (Attributes) (see [below for nested schema](#nestedatt--conditions--datetime_restriction))
- `ip_restriction` (Attributes) (see [below for nested schema](#nestedatt--conditions--ip_restriction))
- `require_two_factor_auth` (Boolean) Whether to require two-factor authentication.

<a id="nestedatt--conditions--datetime_restriction"></a>
### Nested Schema for `conditions.datetime_restriction`

Read-Only:

- `after` (String) The start time for datetime restriction.
- `before` (String) The end time for datetime restriction.


<a id="nestedatt--conditions--ip_restriction"></a>
### Nested Schema for `conditions.ip_restriction`

Read-Only:

- `mode` (String) The mode of IP restriction.
- `source_network` (List of String) The source networks for IP restriction.



<a id="nestedatt--password_policy"></a>
### Nested Schema for `password_policy`

Read-Only:

- `min_length` (Number) The minimum length of the password.
- `require_lowercase` (Boolean) Whether to require lowercase letters in the password.
- `require_symbols` (Boolean) Whether to require symbols in the password.
- `require_uppercase` (Boolean) Whether to require uppercase letters in the password.
